Note: The participant skipped the steps for pairing the band and connected a different band instead. So I had them unpair and reconnect it.
Participant started the hypertrail game at this point.
When I tried to speak to the user , I noticed they would lift up the glasses to see me. They mentioned it was because the volume was loud.
In terms of hand gestures , the participant mentioned that the hypertrail game did not respond very well to the downward scroll motion and it mistook that for a right swipe.
Participant feedback- the screen was clear and crisp. I however noticed that they were looking in the direction of the tv which provides a darker background for contrast.
The band is currently disconnected ( on its own)  via Bluetooth but it still responds to the hand gestures.
Participant feedback- the controls tend to be “off” at a point. That is - not responding well to the exact gesture indicated.
Participant feedback - the video quality was not perfect but overall it was good. The picture quality was maintained but the video feed would break intermittently.
The glasses battery died at 110 min into the session. The participant continued to watch reels on the phone for the remaining 10 min.
